QuestionStatement: The use of game theory to explain strategic behavior among firms is most associated with which of the following market structures?
AnswerChoices: Perfect competition
Monopolistic competition
Oligopoly
Monopoly
Monopsony

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true for a monopolistically competitive firm in long-run equilibrium?
AnswerChoices: It earns a normal profit
It sets price equal to marginal cost
It is allocatively efficient
It is a price taker
It produces at minimum average total cost

QuestionStatement: If the government imposes a per-unit tax on the output of a monopoly with a downward sloping demand curve, the burden of the tax will be
AnswerChoices: Borne entirely by consumers
Borne entirely by the monopolist
Borne entirely by the government
Shared by the monopolist and the government
Shared by consumers and the monopolist

QuestionStatement: If Lock chooses to charge the low price, the best course of action for Star would be to charge the
AnswerChoices: Low price and earn a profit of $40
Low price and earn a profit of $50
High price and earn a profit of $50
High price and earn a profit of $70
High price and incur a loss of $20

QuestionStatement: One difference between a firm in a perfectly competitive market and an unregulated monopoly is that the
AnswerChoices: Perfectly competitive firm can increase the quantity it sells at the market price, whereas the monopoly must lower its price to sell more
Perfectly competitive firm sells differentiated products, whereas the monopoly sells a homogeneous product
Price elasticity of demand for a monopoly is much higher than that for a perfectly competitive firm
Monopolist seeks to maximize profits, whereas the perfectly competitive firm maximizes revenue
Monopolist can never change a price, whereas the perfect competitor can

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is always true of a monopoly that is producing a level of output such that marginal revenue is negative?
AnswerChoices: It is experiencing economies of scale in production
It is maximizing total revenue
It is producing where demand is price elastic
It could lower price to increase profits
It could decrease output to increase profits

QuestionStatement: A cartel is difficult to maintain for which of the following reasons?
AnswerChoices: Consumers substitute away from the good when the price increases
Individual cartel members are tempted to cheat on the agreement
Although the total gain to cartel members is positive, all members lose when everyone sticks to the agreement
Some firms will reduce output in an effort to lower costs of production
Oligopolistic behavior is generally predictable

AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: A monopolist is inefficient from society’s point of view because
AnswerChoices: It overproduces output and charges a price above marginal cost
It underproduces output and charges a price above marginal cost
It sometimes colludes with other firms to obtain higher prices
The price the monopolist charges is too low and it does not advertise
Consumers must pay whatever price the monopolist charges

QuestionStatement: If SteveR Incorporated in a monopolistic producer of diamonds, the firm’s demand curve is downward sloping because
AnswerChoices: The number of diamonds SteveR Incorporated offers for sale affects the price of diamonds
Marginal revenue is negative throughout the range of the demand curve
Marginal revenue is positive throughout the range of the demand curve
The diamond industry consists of a few firms selling similar diamonds
The demand for diamonds is inelastic

QuestionStatement: Over the past 5 years, 50 new restaurants have opened and 30 have closed in the city of Zuni.  Currently there are 110 restaurants operating in the city.  Which of the following best represents the market structure, barriers to entry, and economic profits in the long run?            Market Structure            Barriers to Entry       Long-Run Economic Profitsa.      Perfect Competition            low                  negative      b.      Perfect competition                        high                  positivec.      Monopolistic competition            low                  zerod.      Monopolistic competition            high                  positivee.      Monopolistic competition            high                  zero
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is necessary for a firm to practice price discrimination?
AnswerChoices: The government strictly enforces antitrust laws
The firm is a member of a cartel
The firm can prevent resale of its goods
The demand curve for the product is perfectly inelastic
The demand curve for the product is perfectly elastic

QuestionStatement: A monopolistically competitive firm’s demand curve will be highly elastic if which of the following exists?
AnswerChoices: A high degree of product differentiation
A highly elastic supply curve for the firm
High barriers to entry in this industry
A high degree of product substitutability
A small number of competitors

QuestionStatement: Compared to a perfectly competitive industry with the same demand and cost curves, a monopoly’s price and output will be which of the following?                     Price            Outputa.      The same            Higherb.      Higher            The samec.      Higher            Lowerd.      Lower            The samee.      Lower            Higher
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: The characteristic of oligopolistic firms that makes them different from all other types of firms is that oligopolistic firms
AnswerChoices: are regulated by a state agency or federal agency
consider each other’s decisions
advertise their products
produce differentiated products
produce identical products

QuestionStatement: For the firm shown in the graph above, the short- run, profit-maximizing strategy would be to set output at
AnswerChoices: Q1, price at P1, and suffer a loss
Q1, price at P3, and earn an economic profit
Q1, price at P3, and earn only a normal profit
Q2, price at P2, and earn an economic profit
Q2, price at P2, and earn only a normal profit

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements correctly identifies a difference between perfect competition and monopolistic competition?
AnswerChoices: In perfect competition there are no barriers to entry, but there are strong barriers in monopolistic competition
In perfect competition there are many firms, but in monopolistic competition there are only a few firms
In perfect competition the firms all sell products that are exactly the same, but in monopolistic competition each firm sells a slightly differentiated product

In perfect competition firms maximize profit by selling the quantity where marginal revenue equals marginal cost, but in monopolistic competition firms maximize profit by selling the quantity where marginal revenue exceeds marginal cost
In perfect competition there are few consumers, but in monopolistic competition there are many consumers

QuestionStatement: The most profitable level of output for any firm operating in the short run is the level of output at which
AnswerChoices: marginal revenue exceeds marginal cost by the highest amount
marginal revenue equals marginal cost
price exceeds average cost by the highest amount
price equals average cost
price equals marginal cost

QuestionStatement: For an unregulated monopolist, the profit- maximizing quantity will always be
AnswerChoices: in the elastic region of the demand curve
where marginal revenue equals price
where price equals average total cost
where price equals marginal cost
where the marginal cost curve intersects the demand curve

QuestionStatement: If a per-unit tax is imposed on a monopolist, how will the monopolist’s marginal cost curve, output, and the price paid by consumers be affected?        Marginal Cost       Output        Pricea.      Shift down            Increase      Decreaseb.      Shift down            Decrease      Decreasec.      No shift            Decrease      Decreased.      Shift up            Decrease      Increasee.      Shift up            Increase      Increase
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Monopolistically competitive firms are considered inefficient in allocating society’s resources for which of the following reasons?
AnswerChoices: In equilibrium, the marginal benefit exceeds the price charged by the firms
In equilibrium, the marginal benefit exceeds the marginal cost of production
In equilibrium, the marginal revenue of the firm is not equal to its marginal cost
In long-run equilibrium, the firm is earning economic profits
Firms exhibit significant market power and therefore the number of firms in the industry is strictly limited

QuestionStatement: In order for a firm to engage in price discrimination, it must be
AnswerChoices: able to separate consumers into different groups based on demand elasticities
producing in the inelastic portion of its demand curve to raise its price and increase total revenue
a price taker
experiencing economies of scale in the _relevant range of production
experiencing constant marginal cost

QuestionStatement: The following table shows the profits associated with the pricing strategies of two oligopolistic firms, Agronomia and Farmingdale. Each firm has two possible strategies: to charge a low price or a high price. The first entry in each cell shows the profits to Agronomia and the second the profits to Farmingdale.If the two firms do not cooperate, as a result of the firms’ pricing decisions the profits of each firm will be which of the following?      Argonomia’s Profit      Farmingdale’s Profita.      $50            $100b.      $150            $150c.      $300            $50d.      $100            $100e.      $300            $300
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Productive efficiency occurs when a firm produces output at a level at which
AnswerChoices: average total cost equals average revenue
average total cost is at a minimum
price exceeds average total cost
price equals marginal cost
marginal revenue exceeds average revenue

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of a monopolistically competitive firm in long-run equilibrium?
AnswerChoices: Price equals marginal cost and average total cost
Price equals average total cost but is greater than marginal cost
Price equals marginal cost and is greater than average total cost
The firm makes no attempt to differentiate its products
The firm earns positive economic profits by producing at minimum average cost
